there is no debate without both sides taking an open mind, otherwise, it's just a bunch of repetitive mudslinging.
 
 when someone changes their mind from one side to the other, major or minor, during a debate, they gain my respect instantly.
 
 this should be common sense, but surprisingly, a closed-minded debates occur about 75% of the time.

Yes absolutely. 
 There is no point in a debate if the debaters do not enter the debate with an open mind. 
 
 The one who will gain the most out of the debate is not the "winner" of the debate but rather the one who learned and grew in their knowledge and debating skills the most.
 
 If you want to be open minded you must think of a debate as a learning session or discussion rather than some sort of a contest.
 
 Nice new forum by the way!
i'd also suggest to read other's arguments without taking a side. read it as if you are reading the particular subject for the first time.

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  open mind
